catalogue_raissonne: Copy after the following: Hind 179; Bartsch 8 (vol. 13, p. 53); Zanetti 123; Duchesne 170;  Dutuit Epreuves sur Papier 217; Passavant 170 (vol. 1) and 74 (vol. 5)
creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: male figure wrapped in robes at center, holding staff with cross at top and image of lamb within oval; figure points an inscription with his PL hand on the unrolling, wind-blown scroll in his PR hand; stylized trees and boulders in background
inscription:
Inscription

-- inscribed in plate in reverse: [ECE AGNVS]
-- in graphite on verso: a14759
-- in graphite on mount: [Inv 29112]
-- in graphite on inside mount, corner: OSX
provenance: [Kennedy Galleries, New York, no. 29112; sold to Andrus]; John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie; gave to MIA, 2015. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
title: St. John the Baptist
